title: Why is the Man of Constant Sorrow such a sad guy? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to the lyrics, he has had to leave his beloved Kentucky, and board a north bound train. Presumably , a lack of job opportunities have led him to take this step, and he despairs of seeing his true love again, or even his good friends. These are common themes in country music, the blues, folk, and even rock: A yearning for one’s home is almost as powerful as Willie Nelson’s infamous definition of what makes the jukebox play: “A lot of people are not currently living with their first choice.” Being homesick or lovesick or god forbid both could certainly make a man constantly sorrowful.
